intro: Thymophylla tenuiloba var. texana, commonly known as Texas thymophylla, is a rare flowering plant native to the United States, specifically found in Texas. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in open habitats, such as prairies or disturbed areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
